phase.name: TOON Infrastructure
phase.purpose: Create parser and compiler toolchain that transforms TOON source into Claude Code compliant output

step.name: Create TOON Compiler
step.description:
Implement compiler that orchestrates the complete TOON toolchain pipeline.

Pipeline: read .toon file → parse (01-01) → detect file type → select template (01-02/01-03/01-04) → render → write output .md

CRITICAL: All dependencies (01-01 through 01-04) MUST be complete and stable before starting.
Compiler requires: parser API contract, template input schemas, file type detection strategy.

PREREQUISITE CHECKLIST (ALL MUST BE CHECKED BEFORE STARTING):
- [ ] Parser (01-01) has stable API documented with example I/O
- [ ] Parser output schema finalized as TypedDict or dataclass with explicit 'type' field
- [ ] All three templates (01-02, 01-03, 01-04) have passing tests
- [ ] File type detection rules explicitly documented
- [ ] Template file paths and discovery mechanism specified
- [ ] Exception hierarchy defined (ParseError, TemplateNotFoundError, RenderError, ValidationError)
- [ ] Template acceptance criteria aligned and consistent
step.motivation: Compiler is the build tool that produces all distributable files
step.estimated_hours: 6-8 (assumes dependencies are stable; 12+ if clarifications needed during implementation)

constraints: DO NOT CREATE NEW REPORT FILES
DO NOT COMMIT BEFORE USER APPROVAL
Tests use business language and domain concepts
Type system makes wrong state non-representable

success_criteria_mapping.SC2: Build produces Claude Code compliant output

acceptance_criteria: Compiler selects correct template based on file type using explicit 'type' field from parser output
Compiler writes output to specified directory (creates directory if missing, validates write permissions)
Compiler reports errors clearly on parse/template failures with error type, file path, human-readable message, and suggested fix
Compiler validates output against type-specific schema (see deliverables.output_validation_schemas)
Compiler prevents overwriting existing files without explicit confirmation or uses atomic rename pattern
Compiler rejects paths with '..' or absolute paths to prevent path traversal attacks
Compiler validates TOON file size before parsing (reject files > 10MB to prevent DoS)
Compiler uses Jinja2 in strict mode with disabled functions/variables to prevent code injection
Compiler provides clear error messages that include context: file path, error type, line number (if applicable), suggested fix

file_type_detection.strategy: Parser output MUST include explicit 'type' field (Literal['agent', 'command', 'skill'])
file_type_detection.implementation: Compiler reads parsed_data['type'] to select appropriate template
file_type_detection.required_parser_schema: Parser must return TypedDict or dataclass with 'type' field - this is a BLOCKER dependency
file_type_detection.template_discovery: Use Jinja2 FileSystemLoader with explicit path: tools/toon/templates/
file_type_detection.path_validation: Validate all template paths to prevent path traversal - only allow files from tools/toon/templates/ directory
file_type_detection.fallback: If type field missing, raise ValidationError with clear message - DO NOT infer (ambiguity risk)

edge_cases.empty_toon_file: Raise ValidationError if parser returns empty dict or missing required fields
edge_cases.ambiguous_type: Raise ValidationError if file could be interpreted as multiple types
edge_cases.unknown_type: Raise ValidationError if type field contains value not in ['agent', 'command', 'skill']

output_validation_schemas.note: CRITICAL: These schemas MUST align with template outputs from 01-02/01-03/01-04. Validation will FAIL if templates change without updating these schemas.

agent.validation: Parse as YAML and check required keys: name, description, model, commands

command.validation: Check markdown headers present: ## Execution Context, ## Success Criteria

skill.validation: Parse YAML frontmatter and validate trigger list is non-empty

validation_architecture.design: Use type-specific validator classes instead of monolithic validator to prevent unmaintainability as templates evolve
validation_architecture.pattern: Factory pattern: get_validator(type) returns AgentOutputValidator | CommandOutputValidator | SkillOutputValidator
validation_architecture.benefit: Templates can evolve independently without breaking validator logic

exception_hierarchy.description: Explicit exception types for clear error reporting and handling
exception_hierarchy.base: TOONCompilerError(Exception) - base exception for all compiler errors

types.ParseError: Raised when parser fails on malformed TOON syntax
types.TemplateNotFoundError: Raised when template file missing at runtime
types.RenderError: Raised when Jinja2 template rendering fails
types.ValidationError: Raised when output validation fails or input is invalid
types.FileAccessError: Raised when input file unreadable or output directory not writable
types.SecurityError: Raised when path traversal or code injection detected

error_format.example: ParseError: Failed to parse agent.toon at line 42: Invalid YAML syntax. Suggested fix: Check for unmatched quotes or indentation errors.

security.sandbox: Use Jinja2 SandboxedEnvironment to prevent code execution

jinja2_configuration.environment_isolation: Create fresh environment per render to prevent state leakage between template types

tdd_approach.outer_test:
GIVEN a valid agent.toon file at input_path
WHEN I call compiler.compile(input_path, output_dir)
THEN output_dir contains agent.md with valid Claude Code format

implementation_sequence: 1. Input validation: File size check, path validation, security checks
2. Parser integration: Call parser with error handling
3. File type detection: Read 'type' field from parser output
4. Template discovery: Use FileSystemLoader to find template file
5. Template rendering: Render with sandboxed Jinja2 environment
6. Output validation: Use type-specific validator (Factory pattern)
7. Atomic write: Write to temp file, then atomic rename

All acceptance criteria validated - 10 AC items

error_handling_requirements.error_message_format: Must include: error_type, file_path, message, suggested_fix

2. Set up Jinja2 environment with template loader

execution_guidance.template_resolution_clarification: Recommend storing templates in tools/toon/templates/ with naming pattern: {type}.md.j2 (agent.md.j2, command.md.j2, skill.md.j2). Compiler should use filename pattern matching for discovery.
execution_guidance.error_handling_specificity: Define specific exception hierarchy: ParseError, TemplateNotFoundError, RenderError, ValidationError. Each should include context (file path, line number if applicable).
execution_guidance.acceptance_criterion_5_note: Output validation requires validation schema. Options: (1) Validate YAML frontmatter structure, (2) Check for required markdown sections, (3) Both. Current criterion is vague - recommend clarification with acceptance criteria author.

potential_issues.issue: AC criterion 5 'validates output has required sections' is untestable without section definition
potential_issues.recommendation: Define required sections for each file type (agent.md, command.md, skill.md) before implementation. Three templates have INCOMPATIBLE AC definitions.

potential_issues.issue: No explicit contract between parser (1.1) and compiler on return type/exceptions
potential_issues.recommendation: Step 1.1 has undefined output schema (dict vs TypedDict vs dataclass). This breaks compiler. Compiler cannot be implemented without parser schema.
Step 1.2: output format undefined. Step 1.3: input/output vague. Step 1.4: trigger semantics undefined. Templates cannot be tested without schema.

potential_issues.issue: Circular dependency: templates need parser schema, parser blocked on template feedback
potential_issues.recommendation: Redesign: define parser output schema BEFORE implementing templates. Break circular dependency.

potential_issues.issue: File type detection logic undefined - how does compiler know if input is agent/command/skill?
potential_issues.recommendation: Add explicit file type field to parser output, or define content-based detection rules with examples.

potential_issues.issue: Refactoring targets (Levels 2-3) will be thrown away if dependencies change during implementation
potential_issues.recommendation: Delay refactoring until dependencies stabilize. Refactoring unstable code wastes effort.

potential_issues.issue: Error reporting acceptance criterion lacks specificity on 'clearly'
potential_issues.recommendation: Define clear error format: Include file path, error type, human-readable message, and suggested fix when applicable.

contradictions_found.title: Dependency Fulfillment Status Contradiction
contradictions_found.description: Task declares dependencies [1.1, 1.2, 1.3, 1.4] but all have fundamental unresolved issues. Step 1.1 has undefined output schema. Steps 1.2/1.3/1.4 cannot be tested without parser schema. This creates circular dependency: templates need parser output schema, parser output blocked pending template feedback.
contradictions_found.impact: CASCADING FAILURE - Templates and parser are mutually blocked

contradictions_found.title: Acceptance Criteria vs Achievability Contradiction
contradictions_found.description: AC#5 'validates output has required sections' assumes knowing what sections each template produces. But templates have conflicting AC definitions (agent template: activation notice + frontmatter; command template: agent-activation header + wave metadata; skill template: skill frontmatter + trigger patterns). AC#5 validator cannot validate three incompatible schemas.
contradictions_found.impact: AC#5 is impossible to implement correctly

contradictions_found.title: Refactoring Levels vs Arrival State Contradiction
contradictions_found.description: Task specifies refactoring Levels 2-3 (extract detection strategy, separate compilation pipeline). But if templates change format during implementation (due to schema clarifications), all refactoring work breaks. Each template change cascades: compiler's file type detection breaks, rendering pipeline breaks, refactoring is wasted.
contradictions_found.impact: Refactoring effort will be thrown away

contradictions_found.title: Estimated Hours vs Reality Contradiction
contradictions_found.description: Stated estimate: 3-4 hours. Realistic estimate accounting for undefined dependencies: 6-8 hours minimum, 12+ hours if clarifications needed during implementation. Estimate assumes all dependencies are stable and documented.

dangerous_assumptions.assumption: Parser API is finalized and documented
dangerous_assumptions.reality: Parser (1.1) has undefined output schema. May return dict, TypedDict, dataclass, or custom class. API completely undocumented.

Three templates have incompatible AC definitions. Agent template AC mentions 'activation notice', command template mentions 'agent-activation header' (different), skill template mentions neither. Output schemas are fundamentally misaligned.
No mechanism specified for determining if TOON file is agent/command/skill. Parser output schema undefined, so no field available for detection. Content-based detection would be brittle.
Templates receive parsed data as input. Parser input schema undefined. Templates cannot be tested without knowing input contract. Tests are orphaned.

dangerous_assumptions.assumption: Jinja2 environment is stable across renders
dangerous_assumptions.reality: No specification for environment setup, loader configuration, filter isolation, or context cleanup. State leakage between renders likely.

unhandled_edge_cases.impact: File type detection fails; parser returns empty dict; template rendering receives no context; output may be invalid
Exception type not defined; error reporting undefined; exception handling ad-hoc
Jinja2 TemplateNotFound exception; no graceful handling; unclear error message

unhandled_edge_cases.case: Output directory missing or not writable
unhandled_edge_cases.impact: Create directory? Fail? Behavior undefined; silent failure possible
Multiple valid templates; tests conflict; no disambiguation rules
Jinja2 renders in loops; memory exhaustion; deadlock possible

failure_scenarios.title: Template Schema Mismatch

failure_scenarios.title: Circular Dependency in Step Chain
failure_scenarios.scenario: Parser blocked waiting for template feedback. Templates blocked waiting for parser schema. Compiler blocked on both.

failure_scenarios.title: File Type Detection Fails on Real TOON
failure_scenarios.scenario: File type detection based on assumed structure. Real TOON files (agents/novel-editor-chatgpt-toon.txt) have different structure.
cascade: Tests pass on synthetic data but fail on real

failure_scenarios.title: Refactoring Throws Away All Work
failure_scenarios.scenario: Extract detection strategy into class. Refactoring accidentally loses error handling.

failure_scenarios.title: Validator Becomes Unmaintainable
failure_scenarios.scenario: Templates evolve independently. Each changes section names. Validator logic becomes tangled with type-specific exceptions.

BLOCKER_001.title: TOON Toolchain Missing
BLOCKER_001.impact: Cannot parse TOON files, blocks all Phase 1 steps
resolution_options: B: Pivot to Markdown templates (8-10h, loses TOON benefits)
C: Block until external TOON library available

BLOCKER_002.title: Parser Output Schema Undefined
BLOCKER_002.evidence: Step 01-01 has no documented API, return type unknown (dict? TypedDict? dataclass?)
BLOCKER_002.impact: Compiler cannot integrate with parser without knowing output schema
BLOCKER_002.resolution: Define parser output schema as TypedDict or dataclass with explicit 'type' field

BLOCKER_003.title: Circular Dependency Between Parser and Templates
BLOCKER_003.evidence: Templates need parser schema, parser needs template feedback - circular dependency
BLOCKER_003.resolution: Define parser output schema BEFORE implementing templates to break circular dependency

BLOCKER_004.title: Template Acceptance Criteria Misalignment
BLOCKER_004.evidence: Three templates (01-02/01-03/01-04) have conflicting AC definitions
BLOCKER_004.impact: Compiler's output validator cannot validate three incompatible schemas
BLOCKER_004.resolution: Align template AC to consistent schema and section naming

BLOCKER_005.title: File Type Detection Rules Undefined
BLOCKER_005.evidence: No mechanism specified for determining if TOON file is agent/command/skill
BLOCKER_005.resolution: Parser must include explicit 'type' field in output schema

blocker_resolution_summary.recommendation: DO NOT START 01-05 until all blockers resolved. After resolution, 01-05 will complete in stated 6-8 hours.
resolution_sequence: 1. Resolve BLOCKER_001: Set up TOON toolchain infrastructure
2. Resolve BLOCKER_003: Define parser output schema to break circular dependency
3. Resolve BLOCKER_002 and BLOCKER_005: Document parser API with 'type' field
4. Resolve BLOCKER_004: Align template AC to consistent schema
5. THEN start 01-05 implementation with stable dependencies
